playlist.title: Oklahoma Forum
playlist.creator: OETA
playlist.annotation: Weekly discussion of the issues that impact citizens statewide.

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: 2010 Year in Review
track.annotation: We close out 2010 and look ahead to the year 2011 with our guests: Jenni Carlson, The Oklahoman/NewsOK Joe Kelley, KRMG Radio Ron Williams, KISS Radio Keith Gaddie, OU Political Science Professor

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Governor-Elect Mary Fallin
track.annotation: We discuss her historic election and agenda as governor with: Governor-elect Mary Fallin

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Reflections from the Governor and First Lady
track.annotation:
As his term as Oklahoma’s governor comes to an end, we discuss Brad Henry’s eight years in office with:
Governor Brad Henry
First Lady Kim Henry

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: State Question 755
track.annotation:
We discuss the recently-approved State Question 755, which would prohibit Oklahoma judges from looking to legal precepts from other nations or cultures, with:
Andrew Spiropoulos, Professor of Law and Director of the Center for the Study of State Constitutional Law and Government, Oklahoma City University School of Law
Rick Tepker, Professor of Constitutional Law, Employment Law and Equal Employment Opportunity at the University of Oklahoma College of Law
Peter Krug, Professor of Public International Law, International Business Transactions, Human Rights Law, and Comparative Law at the University of Oklahoma College of Law

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Oklahoma Creativity
track.annotation:
We discuss the Creativity World Forum and the importance of creativity and innovation in Oklahoma, with:
Susan McCalmont, Executive Director, Kirkpatrick Foundation and Vice-Chair of Creative Oklahoma.
Rich Taylor, Dean, Weitzenhoffer Family College of Fine Arts at the University of Oklahoma and Chairman of the Creativity World Forum.

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: General Election Preview
track.annotation: OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with political analysts about this year’s political campaigns and the November 2nd general election: Neva Hill, Political Consultant, Neva Hill & Co. Keith Gaddie, Political Science Professor, Univ. of Oklahoma, and Vice President of Research for Sooner Poll Sheryl Lovelady, Director of Women’s Leadership Programs, The Carl Albert Congressional Research and Studies Center

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Candidates for Lieutenant Governor
track.annotation: OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for Oklahoma Lieutenant Governor. This is the seventh and final program in a series featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election. Todd Lamb, Republican nominee for Lieutenant Governor Kenneth Corn, Democratic nominee for Lieutenant Governor

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Candidates for Attorney General
track.annotation:
OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for Oklahoma Attorney General. This is the sixth in a series of programs featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election.
Jim Priest, Democratic nominee for Attorney General
Scott Pruitt, Republican nominee for Attorney General

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Candidates for State Superintendent
track.annotation: OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for State Superintendent of Public Instruction. This is the fifth in a series of programs featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election. Janet Barresi, Republican nominee for State Superintendent Susan Paddack, Democratic nominee for State Superintendent Richard E. Cooper, Independent candidate for State Superintendent

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Candidates for Treasurer
track.annotation:
OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for State Treasurer. This is the fourth in a series of programs featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election.
Ken Miller, Republican nominee for State Treasurer
Stephen Covert, Democratic nominee for State Treasurer

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Candidates for Insurance Commissioner
track.annotation: OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for state Insurance Commissioner. This is the third in a series of programs featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election. Kim Holland, Democratic nominee for Insurance Commissioner John Doak, Republican nominee for Insurance Commissioner

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Candidates for Labor Commissioner
track.annotation:
OETA’s Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for state Labor Commissioner. This is the second in a series of programs featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election.
Lloyd Fields, Democratic nominee for Labor Commissioner
Mark Costello, Republican nominee for Labor Commissioner

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Auditor and Inspector Candidate Forum
track.annotation: OETA's Oklahoma Votes 2010 coverage comes to Oklahoma Forum, with a discussion with the candidates for State Auditor and Inspector. This is the first in a series of programs featuring interviews with the candidates for statewide office, leading up to the November 2 Oklahoma general election. Gary Jones, Republican nominee for Auditor and Inspector Steve Burrage, Democratic nominee for Auditor and Inspector

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: State Question 744
track.annotation: There are eleven state questions on Oklahoma’s general election ballot. We discuss State Question 744 with: Peter J. Rudy, Oklahomans for Responsible Government, creator of Stop744.com Joel Robison, Oklahoma Education Association, Yes on 744

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Birthright Citizenship and the Fourteenth Amendmen
track.annotation: Oklahoma U.S. Senator Tom Coburn recently announced support for Congressional hearings on the citizenship clause of the Fourteenth Amendment as part of national immigration reform. We discuss the Fourteenth Amendment and birthright citizenship, with: Randall Coyne, Professor of Constitutional Law, University of Oklahoma College of Law Andrew Spiropoulos, Professor of Constitutional Law, Oklahoma City University School of Law

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Oklahoma Primary Election
track.annotation:
We discuss the results of the Oklahoma Primary Election, focusing on the races for Governor, U.S. Senate and U.S. House of Representatives, with:
Neva Hill, Political Consultant and owner of Neva Hill & Company
Sheryl Lovelady, Director of the Women’s Leadership Initiative, Carl Albert Center
Keith Gaddie, Professor of Political Science, Univ. of Oklahoma and Vice President of Research for Sooner Poll

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Reviewing the U.S. Supreme Court Term
track.annotation:
We discuss the recently-completed U.S. Supreme Court term with:
University of Tulsa Law Professor Tamara Piety
Oklahoma City University Law Professor Michael O'Shea.
The focus is on three of the court's most important decisions during the 2009-10 term, involving campaign spending, gun rights and criminal law.

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: The Controversy Over Sardis Lake Water Rights
track.annotation: We discuss the efforts by the City of Oklahoma City to acquire rights to the water in southeastern Oklahoma’s Sardis Lake and what it means for the future of Oklahoma water policy with reporters covering the story: Pennie Embry, The Stigler News-Sentinel Scott Carter, The Journal Record Carol Cole-Frowe, Freelance journalist

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: What Makes a Good Governor?
track.annotation:
We discuss a ranking of Oklahoma governors and what it takes to be a good governor, with:
Lee Slater, Attorney and former Secretary of Oklahoma State Election Board
Scott Cooper, Oklahoma Gazette
Dr. Kenny Brown, Chair of History and Geography, University of Central Oklahoma

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Hometown News
track.annotation: We discuss small market newspapers in Oklahoma, with: Rusty Ferguson, The Cleveland American, Hominy News-Progress Gloria Trotter, The Countywide & Sun Jeff Mayo, Sequoyah County Times, Vian Tenkiller News, Eastern Times-Register, Indian Journal, McIntosh County Democrat Dayva Spitzer, Sayre Record & Beckham County Democrat

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: 2010 Oklahoma Election Preview
track.annotation: We discuss the candidates and key races in the 2010 Oklahoma election, with: Dr. Keith Gaddie, Professor of Political Science, Univ. of Oklahoma and Vice-President of Research for Sooner Poll Sheryl Lovelady, Director of Women’s Leadership Initiative, Univ. of Oklahoma and former Public Opinion Researcher and Political Consultant Erin Boeckman, eCapitol Randy Krehbiel, The Tulsa World

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Poverty in Oklahoma
track.annotation: A discussion of poverty in Oklahoma, its causes, effects and solutions.

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: State Capitol Reporter Roundtable
track.annotation:
This week: “State Capitol Reporters Roundtable”
We discuss the 2010 Oklahoma legislative session with capitol reporters:
Scott Carter, The Journal Record
Shawn Ashley, eCapitol
Michael Cross, KOSU Radio

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: The Gulf Oil Spill Disaster and its Impact on the
track.annotation: We discuss the “Deepwater Horizon” oil spill disaster and how it affects energy policy and Oklahoma’s oil and gas industry, with: Lori Wrotenbery, Director, Oil and Gas Division, Oklahoma Corporation Commission Pete Brown, Past Chairman, Board of Directors of the Oklahoma Energy Resources Board Bud Scott, Chapter Director, Oklahoma Sierra Club

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Public Service Media
track.annotation:
We discuss public broadcasting – its role, funding and future - with:
John McCarroll, Executive Director, OETA-The Oklahoma Network
Ted Riley, General Manager, KCCU Radio, Lawton
Karen Holp, General Manager, KGOU Radio, Norman

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: State Capitol Reporters Roundtable
track.annotation: We discuss the state budget situation, recent legislation and the final days of the 2010 legislative session with: Sean Murphy, Associated Press Shawn Ashley, eCapitol Michael McNutt, The Oklahoman /NewsOK Scott Carter, The Journal Record

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: War and Diplomacy in the Middle East
track.annotation: We discuss the current situation in the Middle East, including the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, efforts to reach a political solution and the emerging threat posed by Iran, with: Dr. Zach Messitte, Vice Provost for International Programs, University of Oklahoma Dr. Joshua Landis, Director of the Center for Middle East Studies, University of Oklahoma Mike Boettcher, freelance journalist and former foreign correspondent for CNN, ABC and NBC

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Politics, Religion, and Civility
track.annotation: We discuss the need for civility in public discourse, with: Rev. Dr. C. Welton Gaddy, President, Interfaith Alliance

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: The Tea Party Movement
track.annotation: We discuss the Tea Party movement and its impact on politics in 2010 with: Al Gerhart, Founder, Oklahoma Constitutional Alliance Keith Gaddie, Professor of Political Science, University of Oklahoma Richard Johnson, Chair for Department of Political Science, Oklahoma City University

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Legislative Leadership
track.annotation: We discuss the state budget situation and health care reform with: Chris Benge, Speaker of the House Glenn Coffee, Senate President Pro Tempore Danny Morgan, House Democratic Leader Charlie Laster, Senate Democratic Leader

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Governor Brad Henry
track.annotation: The Governor of the State of Oklahoma, Brad Henry, joins Dick Pryor to discuss the state budget crisis.

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: The Wars in Iraq and Afghanistan

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Legislative Leader Roundtable
track.annotation: We discuss the State of Oklahoma revenue shortfall and the ongoing state budget concerns, with guests: Rep. Chris Benge, Speaker of the House; Sen. Glenn Coffee, Senate President Pro Tempore; Sen. Andrew Rice, Senate Democratic Leader-Elect; Rep. Danny Morgan, House Democratic Leader

track.title: Oklahoma Forum
track.ov:subtitle: Blurring the Line Between News and Opinion

track.title: The Civil Rights Movement Then and Now
The Changing Landscape of Indian Country
Judge Sotomayor and the Supreme Court
Medical Research in Oklahoma
track.annotation: A discussion of medical research in Oklahoma, including stem cells and cloning.

track.title: The Rise of Extremism in Oklahoma
track.annotation: A discussion of the new U.S. Department of Homeland Security assessment on rightwing extremism and the reaction to it,

track.title: The 1st Ammendment and the Ten Commandments
The 1st Amendment adn the Ten Commandments Part 2
track.annotation: Continuation of discussion of the 1st Ammendments and the 10 Commandments plus Hometown News

track.title: Living with Autism
track.annotation: Dick Pryor discusses Living with Autism with Melissa and Chris Akerson and Shannon Roberson.

track.title: Living with Autism Part 2
track.annotation: continuation of Living with Autism Interview and Hometown News
